data.title: How do I find-and-replace everything in a folder?
data.body:
This interaction isn't immediately obvious. There's no find button, but it appears that pressing enter is equivalent to "find". `in` isn't clear as to what is expected. My guess is that when it's blank it searches the current document, and I can fill it with file paths (based on sublime text behavior), but there's nothing indicating that. Sublime has the option to choose folders with a dialogue, that just fill text into the field. It's a smooth interaction and makes it clear how the thing works.

![screen shot 2013-12-03 at 4 09 20 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/72919/1669429/5871b878-5c78-11e3-8f82-0a5de5ce0bfd.png)

So realtalk, how do I search a folder?

data.title: Atom opens full screen height every time no matter what I do
data.body: It seems at some point it remembered how you last opened a project or something and would open to those dimensions.

data.title: Strange telepath bug
data.body:
My cursor was after the word gist on the last line and I pasted  some text which resulted in this error:

```
Uncaught Error: Index out of range /Users/corey/github/atom/node_modules/telepath/lib/string.js:270
module.exports.String.pointForIndex /Users/corey/github/atom/node_modules/telepath/lib/string.js:270

(anonymous function) /Users/corey/github/atom/node_modules/telepath/lib/string.js:177
module.exports.String.getMarker /Users/corey/github/atom/node_modules/telepath/lib/string.js:182
(anonymous function) /Users/corey/github/atom/node_modules/telepath/lib/string.js:190
module.exports.String.getMarkers /Users/corey/github/atom/node_modules/telepath/lib/string.js:187
module.exports.TextBuffer.getMarkers /Users/corey/github/atom/src/text-buffer.coffee:423
module.exports.DisplayBuffer.getMarkers /Users/corey/github/atom/src/display-buffer.coffee:487
module.exports.DisplayBuffer.pauseMarkerObservers /Users/corey/github/atom/src/display-buffer.coffee:579
module.exports.DisplayBuffer.emitChanged /Users/corey/github/atom/src/display-buffer.coffee:147
module.exports.DisplayBuffer.updateScreenLines /Users/corey/github/atom/src/display-buffer.coffee:684
module.exports.DisplayBuffer.handleTokenizedBufferChange /Users/corey/github/atom/src/display-buffer.coffee:645
(anonymous function) /Users/corey/github/atom/src/display-buffer.coffee:3
(anonymous function) /Users/corey/github/atom/node_modules/emissary/lib/emitter.js:132
module.exports.Emitter.emit /Users/corey/github/atom/node_modules/emissary/lib/emitter.js:131
module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.tokenizeNextChunk /Users/corey/github/atom/src/tokenized-buffer.coffee:204
(anonymous function) /Users/corey/github/atom/src/tokenized-buffer.coffee:172
(anonymous function)
```

If I close and reopen Atom the problem persists, even after clearing out ~/.atom/storage.

data.title: Adjusting padding for new tabs

**After**

data.title: Use grunt-download-atom-shell to download and update atom-shell.
data.body:
I separate the update-atom-shell task to a third party grunt task, so it would be easier for other applications to download atom-shell. 

However since it's a private repository, I cannot publish it to npm registry. I tried to use `git+ssh://` URLs to set it as private package in `package.json`, but it seems that the CI doesn't have necessary credentials to clone the private repositories:

(using `git+https://`):

```
npm ERR! git clone https://github.com/atom/grunt-download-atom-shell.git Cloning into bare repository '/var/lib/jenkins/.atom/.node-gyp/.atom/.apm/_git-remotes/https-github-com-atom-grunt-download-atom-shell-git-424746b3'...
npm ERR! git clone https://github.com/atom/grunt-download-atom-shell.git 
npm ERR! git clone https://github.com/atom/grunt-download-atom-shell.git fatal: could not read Username for 'https://github.com': Device not configured
```

(using `git+ssh://`):

```
npm ERR! git clone git@github.com:atom/grunt-download-atom-shell.git Cloning into bare repository '/var/lib/jenkins/.atom/.node-gyp/.atom/.apm/_git-remotes/git-github-com-atom-grunt-download-atom-shell-git-4a6c63fe'...
npm ERR! git clone git@github.com:atom/grunt-download-atom-shell.git 
npm ERR! git clone git@github.com:atom/grunt-download-atom-shell.git ERROR: Repository not found.
npm ERR! git clone git@github.com:atom/grunt-download-atom-shell.git fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
npm ERR! git clone git@github.com:atom/grunt-download-atom-shell.git 
npm ERR! git clone git@github.com:atom/grunt-download-atom-shell.git Please make sure you have the correct access rights
npm ERR! git clone git@github.com:atom/grunt-download-atom-shell.git and the repository exists.
npm ERR! Error: Command failed: ERROR: Repository not found.
npm ERR! fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Please make sure you have the correct access rights
npm ERR! and the repository exists.
```

Finally instead of working around npm, I published `grunt-download-atom-shell` to apm registry and treated it like other atom packages, and it works. Though it's not beautiful and causes some confusions, it's the easiest way I can think out, or maybe there is a better way?

data.title: Update atom-shell to v0.7.3.
Use buffer positions for char width cache
data.body: Wrapped lines were previously causing incorrect offsets to be cached causing the cursor to appear out of place as shown in #1096

data.title: Install packages via custom URI handler
data.body:
![2013-12-02 at 5 28 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1476/1660347/8cfee674-5bba-11e3-9b44-1d99955d326c.png)

I believe we casually discussed this in person or in Chat, but I couldn't find a follow-up issue. I think it would be really excellent. In the meantime we can work around on the site with instructions for install through the editor or CLI, but that's a bit clunky.

data.title: Path info gets stuck over tabs
data.body: I've ended up in this state a few times. I have no idea how/when it happens as I wasn't paying attention, but once it is there it doesn't go away without restarting.

data.title: Use classes instead of ids
data.body:
- `#workspace` :arrow_right: `.workspace`
- `#horizontal` :arrow_right: `.horizontal`
- `#vertical` :arrow_right: `.vertical`
- `#panes` :arrow_right: `.panes`

Closes #1179

data.title: Autosave errors in new (unsaved) files
data.body: When I open a new file and unfocus it, autosave pops open devtools and errors `Uncaught Error: Can't save buffer with no file path`. Autosave shouldn't be trying to save in new files.

data.title: Removing core treeview settings
data.body: Removing .focusable-pannel from the core app and adding to default themes with a more subtle transition. cc @benogle

data.title: I switched to cmd-ctrl-shift-p for window:reload, w
data.body:
I switched to cmd-ctrl-shift-p for window:reload, which lets me keep my hands on their appropriate sides of the keyboard. Do you think this would be a better default than ctrl-opt-cmd-r?

User: jbarnette
Atom Version: 3053c4a
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/3053c4a Safari/537.36

data.title: Update atom-shell to v0.7.2.
data.body:
From atom-shell v0.7.2 we are using the new [breakpad](https://code.google.com/p/google-breakpad/wiki/GettingStartedWithBreakpad) crash reporter on both Windows and OS X, it doesn't require any symbol files to be present on users' machine, and we can generate nice stack traces on the server.

The crash reports submission url is temporarily set to the default one (http://54.249.141.255:1127), which is my ec2 machine running the [atom/mini-breakpad-server](https://github.com/atom/mini-breakpad-server).

Currently the operating system libraries' symbols were not resolved on the server side, since we need to generate breakpad symbols for all system libraries on all versions of operation systems. On Windows it's possible to generate the symbols from Microsoft's debugging symbols server, and Mozilla [has a script to do it](https://wiki.mozilla.org/Breakpad:Symbols#Windows_system_symbols). On OS X we can just manually generate the symbols on 10.9 and 10.8.

data.title: A binding of `ctrl-w v` in `.workspace` is not working
data.body:
This doesn't work:

``` coffee
".workspace":
  "ctrl-w v": "pane:split-right"
```

But this does:

``` coffee
"body":
  "ctrl-w v": "pane:split-right"
```

data.title: I ran `git mv lib src` in my Terminal. I happened t
data.body:
I ran `git mv lib src` in my Terminal. I happened to have a file in lib (pathology-view.coffee) open in a buffer. A few minutes later I reloaded Atom. It asked me if I wanted to save my modifications to pathology-view.coffee, so I said sure. Now I have a `lib` and a `src` folder. I know we've talked this behavior to death from the perspective of branch changes, etc, but it continues to get in my way pretty frequently.

User: jbarnette
Atom Version: 3053c4a
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/3053c4a Safari/537.36

data.title: If I have a buffer open and then delete its backing
data.body:
If I have a buffer open and then delete its backing file (via the tree-view, but I think it's the same if I do it outside of Atom) the file still shows up in the results of a new project find.

User: jbarnette
Atom Version: 3053c4a
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/3053c4a Safari/537.36

data.title: I love this feedback thingy. I wish it allowed newl
data.body:
I love this feedback thingy. I wish it allowed newlines, and it kinda freaked me out that what I was typing disappeared for a secon when I clicked the "Attach screenshot" checkbox. I don't expect clicking a checkbox to actually perfom an action until I hit "send" or something.

User: jbarnette
Atom Version: 3053c4a
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/3053c4a Safari/537.36

data.body:

data.body: Update the readme, building and contributing docs.

data.title: Jasmine spec runner chokes printing huge failure messages
data.body: When comparing the identity of large objects, Jasmine failures can actually freeze the window. We need to address this somehow. It would be great if Jasmine would use a `::toString` or `::inspect` method on an object if one was present.

data.title: uncaught exception in fresh Atom
data.body:
Grabbed Atom 39.0 last night. Had no ~/.atom directory before running Atom today. Tried to open a project in ~/code/foobar using cmd+o and got this beauty.

![Atom exception](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/358882/1626157/5bb5983e-56dc-11e3-81ec-71f6092cfc87.png)

data.title: Rename EditSession/Editor to Editor/EditorView
data.body:
Continuation of #1132 to packages and remaining core methods.

Refs #950

data.title: Add feedback package
data.body:
This gives users a simple in-app way to give us feedback. Feedback is send directly to the atom repo with the label `feedback`.

![feedback-form-view coffee - _users_corey_ atom_packages_feedback](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/596/1625377/24251850-56d1-11e3-97b6-cdf17ae4f29a.jpg)

Will result create [this issue](https://github.com/atom/feedback/issues/2).

I punted on using the asset api to upload images, but at some point I will circle back and get that working.

data.title: Icon is not part of built Application
data.body:
I just ran (and subsequently re-ran to make sure) `script/build` on master, and I’m no longer getting the Atom icon as part of the built Atom.app in my `/Applications` folder. Instead, I’m getting the default Application icon provided by OSX:

![2013-11-26 at 5 03 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/1625240/3d7ae642-56cf-11e3-875f-fdcb966a233b.png)

/cc @kevinsawicki I mentioned this to you briefly in SF I think?

data.title: Rename RootView to WorkspaceView
data.body:
- `{RootView} = require 'atom'` :arrow_right:  `{WorkspaceView} = require 'atom'`
- `atom.rootView` :arrow_right: `atom.workspaceView`

Refs #950
